segment.source: The topics in this section get you started with using graphics and animations in your store apps.
segment.target: The topics in this section get you started with using graphics and animations in your store apps.

segment.source: Graphics and animation is designed for use by app developers using XAML.
segment.target: Graphics and animation is designed for use by app developers using XAML.

segment.source: If you want to add graphics and animation to a game using Microsoft DirectX, see Games and DirectX.
segment.target: If you want to add graphics and animation to a game using Microsoft DirectX, see Games and DirectX.

segment.source: Draw shapes
segment.target: Draw shapes

segment.source: Learn how to draw shapes, such as ellipses, rectangles, polygons, and paths.
segment.target: Learn how to draw shapes, such as ellipses, rectangles, polygons, and paths.

segment.source: The Path class is the way to visualize a fairly complex vector-based drawing language in a XAML UI; for example, you can draw Bezier curves.
segment.target: The Path class is the way to visualize a fairly complex vector-based drawing language in a XAML UI; for example, you can draw Bezier curves.

segment.source: Use brushes
segment.target: Use brushes

segment.source: Brush objects are used to paint the interiors or outlines of shapes, text, and parts of controls, so that the object being painted is visible in a UI.
segment.target: Brush objects are used to paint the interiors or outlines of shapes, text, and parts of controls, so that the object being painted is visible in a UI.

segment.source: Animations overview
segment.target: Animations overview

segment.source: Use the animations from the Windows Runtime animation library to integrate the Windows look and feel into your app.
segment.target: Use the animations from the Windows Runtime animation library to integrate the Windows look and feel into your app.

segment.source: Transforms overview
segment.target: Transforms overview

segment.source: Learn how to use transforms in the Windows Runtime API, by changing the relative coordinate systems of elements in the UI.
segment.target: Learn how to use transforms in the Windows Runtime API, by changing the relative coordinate systems of elements in the UI.

segment.source: This can be used to adjust the appearance of individual XAML elements, such as scaling, rotating, or transforming the position in x-y space.
segment.target: This can be used to adjust the appearance of individual XAML elements, such as scaling, rotating, or transforming the position in x-y space.

segment.source: Visual layer
segment.target: Visual layer

segment.source: The Windows.UI.Composition API gives you access to the composition layer between the framework layer (XAML), and the graphics layer (DirectX).
segment.target: The Windows.UI.Composition API gives you access to the composition layer between the framework layer (XAML), and the graphics layer (DirectX).

segment.source: The Windows.UI.Composition API allow you to create composition objects and apply powerful animations, effects and manipulations on those objects in your application.
segment.target: The Windows.UI.Composition API allow you to create composition objects and apply powerful animations, effects and manipulations on those objects in your application.
